respect worldly treasure pleasure touchyng stoutnesse prince cause contrary resistaunce duke northumberland agaynst proued right well good minde wayarchb cramer displeasure imployng chauntrey landes chaunced reason would consent dissoluyng chauntreys vntill kyng came age intent might better serue furnish royall estate haue great treasure consumed noneage stoutnes ioyned simplicitie surely thought diuers counsaile thyng incredible specially sort contend accounted realme none would durst gaynstand hym deare cause god prince one would keepe conscience clogged lurke hide head otherwise sayd enemy might easely intreate cause reasonable thyngs graunted without suspition rebraidyng meede therfore altogether voyde vice stubb rnes rather culpable ouer much facilitie gentlenes surely ouermuch patience may vice may seeme peraduenture offend rather part contrary albeit doynges say partthe singular patience archbyshop mortification way shall finde saying sauiour christ much preuailed would onely haue man forgiue enemy also pray lesson neuer went memory knowen many cruell enemy owne desertes onely religion sake yet soeuer either sought hinderaunce either goodes estimation life vpon co came common prouerbe vnto lord canterbury displeasure shrewed turne may sure haue frend while liueth gentle disposition absteinyng reuengement amongest many example therof repeate one story betwen archb caunterbury popish priest enemyit chauced ignoraut priest parson north part towne remebraunce kinsman one chersey grocer dwellyng within londo beyng one priest vse study alchouse chaber study sit time honest neighbour alchouse within parish comunicatio ministred comendation lord cramer archb cant sayd parson enuying name onely religio sake sayd neighbour make quoth hostler hath learnyng goslyngs goeth yonder greene like sclaunderous vncomely wordes honest neighbour well bearyng vnseemely wordsthe rayling popish priest agaynst doct cranmer articled sent coplaynt vnto lord cromwell uicegerent cause ecclesiasticall sent priest committed fleete mindyng haue recant sclaunderous wordes paules crosse howbeit lord cromwell hauing great affaire prince hand forgat prisoner fleete chersey grosser vnderstandyng kinsman duraunce fleete onely speakyng wordes agaynst lord canterbury consulted priest betwene deuised make sute rather vnto archbyshop deliueraunce lord cromwell accused vnderstandyng right well great diuersitie nature betwene two estate one getle full clemency seuere somewhat intractable namely agaynst papist chersey tooke vpon first try lord caterburies benignitie namely cousin accusatio touched onely offence agaynst none whereupon sayd chersey came one archbyshops gentleme whose father bought yearely spice frute sayd chersey thereby familiar acquaintaunce gentleman openyng trouble wherein kinsman requested would meanes lord maister heare sute behalfe kinsman matter moued archbyshop like nature gentle much clemencie would neuer shew selfe straunge vnto suters incontinently sent said chersey came chersey declared kinsman fleete priest north countrey may tell grace truth quoth chersey man small ciuilitie lesse learnyngchersey yng kynse archb yet hath personage reason lord cromwell hath layd prison beyng cure vnserued hee hath continued duraunce aboue two monethes called aunswere knoweth hee shall come end imprisonment consumeth substaunce vtterly vndoe vnlesse grace good lord know sayd archbyshop hath done thus trouble sayd chersey agayne onely hath offended agaynst grace agaynst man el may well perceiued article obiected agaynst copy wherof sayd chersey exhibited vnto sayd archbyshop caunterbury well perusing sayd article sayd common talke ignoraunt papisticall priestes england agaynst surely sayd neuer made priuy vnto accusation induraunce neuer heard tyme notwithstandyng nothing el charge withal prince cou saile request take order send home againe cure duetie therupo sent ryng warden fleetethe priest sent archbyshop willyng send prisoner vnto keeper noone keeper brought prisoner houre appointed chersey well instructed cosin wise submit selfe vnto archbishop confessing fault whereby way easely haue end winne fauour thus parson beyng brought garden lambeth sittyng vnder vyne archbyshop demaunded parson cause induraunce committed fleete parson aunswered sayd lord cromwell sent thether certaine malicious parishioner parish wrongfully accused wordes whiche neuer spake ment chersey hearyng foolish cosin farre way former instruction sayd thou dasterdly olt varlet thy promise thou madest great number thy honest neighbour hades agaynst thee proue thee lyer surely lord quoth chersey pitie doe good sory haue troubled grace thus farre well sayd archbyshop vnto parson haue offended methe archbyshops wordes vnto parson ca good intreated helpe one trouble hath offended agaynst lord cromwell hath committed prison wrongfully lyeth selfe amend offence onely touche bold doe somewhat frendes sake haue offended agaynst haue nothyng may go remaine whence came lord kinsman chersey made callyng kynde opprobrious name end lord caterbury seemyng rise go wayes fond priest fell downe knee sayd beseech grace forgiue doct cole sermon oxford many ho e wordes reproued beyng endued fauour feelyng holesome catholicke doctrine fell contrary opinio pernitious errour onely defended writynges power also allured men like great liberalitie giftes appointyng rewardes errour allured meanes cherish long repeate thyngs long order pronounced summe tripartite declamation wasif cole gaue iudgement vpon cranmer whe hee repented iudgement geue cole whiche alwayes hath p dured errour neuer yet repented hee sayd god mercy tempered iustice altogether require punishment according merites offender yet sometymes suffered altogether goe vnpunished yea though repeted dauid whe bidden chuse three kyndes punishment would chosen pestilence three dayes lord forgaue gaue halfe tyme didnt release thyng came passe hym also although pardon reconciliation due accordyng canon seyng hee repented errours yet cause queene counsell tyme iudged hym death whiche lest hee maruell much heare first beyng traytour dissolued lawfull matrimonie betwene kyng father mother besides driuyng pope authoritie metropolitane heretickes england burned doct cole haue bene ere nowsecondly bene hereticke authour onely fountaine hereticall doctrine schismaticall opinion many yeares haue preuailed england first rise spryng bene secret fauourer onely also earnest defender euen end life sowyng abroad writynges argumentes priuately openly without great ruine decay catholicke church lex non aequalitatis sed iquitatisand seemed meete accordyng law equalitie death duke northumberland late made euen thomas chauncellour dyed churche one make euen fisher rochester ridley hoper farrar able make euen man seemed meete cranmer ioyned fill vp part equalitie beside iust weightie cause seemed queene counsell whiche meete tyme opened common people turnyng tale hearer bad men beware man example among men nothyng high promise selfe safetie earth god vengeauce equally stretched agaynst men spareth none therfore beware learne feare princeno state earth hye sure may fall seyng queenes maiestie would spare notable man much lesse like cause would spare men man thinke make thereby defence errour either rich kynde authoritie example teach whose calamitie euery man might consider owne fortune top dignitie none honorable whole realme next kyng fallen great miserie might see beyng man high degree sometyme one chiefest prelate church archbishop chief cou sell second person realme long tyme man thought greatest assurauce hauyng kyng side notwithstandyng authoritie defence debased high estate low degree counsellour become caitiffe set wretched state poorest wretch would chaunge condition briefly heaped miserie side neither left hope better fortune place worse doct cole encourageth archb take death patientlythe latter part sermon conuerted archbishop comforted encouraged take death well many place scripture like hiddyng mistrust incontinently receiue theefe christ sayd hodie mecum eris paradiso day thou shalt paradise paule armed agaynst terrour fire this1 cor dominus fidelis est non sinet vos tentari vltra quam ferre potestis lord faythful suffer tempted aboue strength example three child god made flame seeme like pleasaunt dew addyng also reioysing andrew crosse patience laurence fire assuryng god called dye fayth either would abate furie flame geue strength abide doct cole reioyseth archbyshops conuersion b reioysing lasted longhe glorified god much conuersion appeared onely worke declaryng trauell conference bene conuert preuayled till pleased god mercy reclayme call home discoursing place much commended cranmer qualified former doynges thus temperyng iudgement talke tyme sayd flowed rich honour vnworthy lyfe might liuedir ge mass promised cranmers soule vnworthy death lest cary comfort would diligently labour hee sayd also hee promise name priestes present immediately death diriges mass funeral executed church oxford succour soule cranmer meane tyme great grief mynde stoode hearyng sermon outward shewes body countenaunce better expresse man declare one liftyng vp handes eye vnto heauen agayne shame lettyng downe earth might haue sene image shape perfite sorrow liuely expressed twentie seuerall tymes teares gushed aboundantlythe teares archb dropped downe marueilously fatherly face present doe testifie neuer saw child teares brast tyme sermon specially hee recited prayer people marueilous commiseration pitie moued men harte beheld heauie countenaunce aboundaunce teares old man reuerend dignitie cole ended sermon called backe people ready depart prayer brother sayd hee lest man doubt man earnest conuersion repentaunce shall heare speake therfore pray maister cranmer cranmer required declare fayth performe promised long agoe namely would openly expresse true vndoubted profession fayth may take away suspition men men may vnderstand catholicke deede cramer willing declare fayth sayd archbyshop good rising vp putting cap began speake thus vnto people desire well beloued brother lord pray god forgeue sinnesthe wordes archb people aboue men number greatnes haue committed among rest one offence whiche tyme doth vexe trouble wherof processe talke shall heare fauour matter haue bene good captayne pardon one faulte first parte difference vntrue surmise determination papistes condemning euer would say contrary common proposition among schoole diuines body christ remaineth long forme bread remayning euer whereof thomas wryteth thusthomas part sum q art quidam vero dixerunt quod qua primum sacramentum sumitur mure vel cane desinit ibi esse corpus christi perin booke printedperyn set abroad matter men read saith although mouse beast doe eate sacrament yet neuerthelesse reall body christ asketh inconuenience verity christ reall body sacrament though impassible body lye mouth maw beast therfore body christ yes vndoubtedly saith abhominable opinion beastly asseuerations truely terme meaning thereby bite appeareth fitte termes meete papist whose vnto worldes end present faihtfull gathered together name diuine power spirite euer v paule saith absent corinthes body present spirite christ sayth gone hence absent humanitie diuine nature euery saying sayth origen diuide humanitie iohn writeth spirite deuideth iesus god reserue nature property wordes origen hath playnly declared mynd christes body present v also gone hence estranged v make meaning theodoret chrysostome place ment reall calling chaungyng substance sacramentall chaunge name remaining substaunces theodoret sayth playne wordes christ called bread body called body corne trueth set forth vntrueth alter theodoretes wordes yet suffiseth geue new straunge signification wordes neuer inuented theodoret sayth sacramentes remayne turne visible matter visible matter take must signify accident theodoret sayth playne termes substaunce remayneth must substaunce also saying signify accidentes call outward nature cotrary doctrine haue taught hetherto substaunce inward nature hostes oblation acceptable christ christ offered selfe v dueties sorte offer selues agayne shall haue name christian vayne pretend belong christ word profession shall deede lyfe inward affection beastes worthy excluded vtterly benefites christes oblation wee put oblation prieste steede oblation christ chap popish masse detestable idolatry vtterly vanished christen congregation refusing receaue sacrament body bloud selues ordeined trustyng haue remission sinnes sacrifice priest masse thereby also obtaine release paynes purgatory onely iniurie christ also commit detestable idolatry false doctrine without shame deuised fayned wicked popish priestes idolater monkes frier lucre altered corrupted holy supper lord turned manifest idolatry wherfore godly men ought hart refuse abhorre questio smith aunswere question could christ come aswell house whe doore shut ye apostle could go prison doore beyng shutactes could god worke thyng except apostle must go doore occuyy place doore could christ much selfe apostle smith blynd owne phantasy seeth much owne example make agaynst selfe lyke sacrament stone doore christes body one propre place body substaunce stone doore must christes body sacramet one propre place body substaunce bread wine must confesse transubstantiation appearyng christ ascentionthen doore sepulchre doct smith commeth reuelations peter paule saw christ sayth bodily vpon earth ascention whiche declareth although christ departed hence tyme ascention heauen sitteth right hand father yet may also blessed sacrament aultar ignorant know christ appeared paule sayd saule saule doest thou persecute meactes augustine augustin sayth christ ascention spake last wordes euer speake vpon earth yet finde christ speaketh sayth heauen heauen vpon earth spake paule aboue saying saule saule doest thou persecute head heauen yet sayd doest thou persecute bycause persecuted member vpon earth please maister smith let blame augustin fayne selfe onely alledge augustin father spake heauen whan sayd beloued sonnemath pleased also stephen saw christ sittyng heauen father right hand euen ment augustin paule haue sene heard christ speake since ascentionactes haue sene heard heauen churchnow papist goyng forward woorkes seeth building feeble weake able stand returneth chief foudation church councels generall willyng men stay thereupon leaue disputyng reasonyng chiefly shoareth vp house councell lateranence whereat sayth xiij hundred father xv telleth viij hundred monkes frier chanons byshop rome owne deare dearelynges chief champion called together name christes broode vypers serpentes thyng thought come dyd proceede fro spirite holy father first begat say spirite antichrist yet know bee true christ present holy churche whiche holy elected people shall worldes end leadyng gouernyng holy spirite teachyng truth necessary saluation euer gathered together name among shall suffer gate hell preuaile agaynst although may suffer owne frailenes tyme erre fall dye yet finally neither sathan hell sinne eternall death shall preuaile agaynst church sea rome whiche accompteth selfe holy catholicke churche byshop therof holy many yeares ago sathan hath preuailed agaynst stinkyng whore babylon abhominations knowen whole world name god blasphemed cup dronkennes poyson haue nation tasted cometh smith beregarius almericus carolostadius oecolampadius zuinglius true fayth church fro begynnyng taught first berengarius affirmyng church euer sithens christes tymes thousand fiue hudreth yeares moe hath beleued christ bodily sacrament neuer taught otherwise vntill berengarius came thousand yeares christ folowed booke haue proued god word old auncient author christ sacrament corporally bodily corporally ascended heauen shall remaine vnto worldes end true church christ euer beleued beginnyng repugnaunce vntill sathan let louse antichrist came papistes fayned new false doctrine contrary god word true catholicke doctrine true fayth god preserueth holy church still doe vnto worldes end maugre wicked antichrist gate hell almighty god time time hath stregthened many holy martirs fayth suffer death antichrist great harlot babilon hath embrewed handes made drunken bloud martyr whose bloud god reuege length although ye meane time suffer patiece fayth holy saynts tried rest preface contayneth nothing elswhat churche ca erre authority church smith sayth cannot wholy erre setteth forth extolleth preferreth aboue god word affirming onely piller truth lesse bee beleued holy scripture also beleue holy scripture maketh word men equall aboue word god truth deed church doth neuer wholy erre euer darcknes god shineth vnto elect midst iniquity gouerneth holy word spirite gate hell preuayle agaynst knowne although world many time know hath derision hatred christ apostle neuerthelesse last day shalbe knowen whole world wicked shal wonder felicity say sometime verision mocked fooles thought liues madness p end without honour loe bloucester sitting iudgement commission romethe kyng queene make themselues better subiectes complaining owne subiect outwarde iudge thogh power punishe ala greue hart naturall subiect accused king queene owne realme specially outward iudge authority comming person realme king queene subiectes within theyr owne realme shall complayne require iustice straungers handes agaynst theyr owne subiect already condemned death owne lawes though king queene could haue iustice within owne realme agaynst owne subiectes must seeke straungers hand straunge land like whereof thinke neuer seene would haue wished haue meaner aduersaryes thinke death shall greeue much haue dread gratious soueraygne lord lady vnder god owe obedience mine accuser iudgement within owne realme straunger outward powerthe first cause hee would make aunswere pope commissary auoyde periury forasmuch time prince famous memory king henry grace father sworne neuer consent byshop rome haue exercise authoritie iurisdiction realme england therefore least allow authority contrary mine oth refused make aunswere byshop gloucester sitting iudgemet pope authority least runne periury second cause ye pope lawes contrary crowne lawes englandan cause refused pope authority authority claimeth repugneth crowne imperiall realme lawes euery true subiect bound defend fyrst pope sayth manner power aswell temporall spirituall geuen first god temporall power geueth vnto emperours kinges vse vnder alwayes comaundement becke contrary clayme emperial crowne iurisdiction temporall realme taken immediately god vsed vnder onely subiect vnto none god alone othe kyng iustices duety subiectesmoreouer imperiall lawes customes realme king coronation iustices receiue office sworne whole realme bound defend maintayne contrary hereunto pope authority maketh voyd commaundeth blot bookes lawes customes repugnant lawes declareth accursed ruler gouernours maker writer executor lawes customes appeareth many pope lawes whereof one two shall rehearse decree distin x written thus constitutione contra canones decreta praesulum romanorum vel bonos more nullius sunt momenti constitution statute enacted agaynst canon decree bishop rome good customes none effect also extra de sententia excommunicationis merit excomunicamus omnes hareticos vtriusque sexus quocumque nomine censeantur fautores receptatores defensores eorum nec non qui de catero sernari fecerint statuta edita consuetudines contra ecclesia libertatem nisiea de capitularibus suis intra duo menses post huiusmodi publicationem sentencia fecerint amoueri item excomunicamus statutarios scriptores statutorum ipsorum nec non potestates consules rectores consiliarios locorum vbi de catero huiusmodi statuta consuetudines edita fuerint velseruatae nec non illos qui secundum ea praesumpserint iudicarem vel publicam formam scribere iudicata say excomunicate heretickes sex name euer called fauourers receptours defender also shall hereafter cause obserued statute customes made agaynst liberty church except cause put bookes recordes within two monethes publication sentence also excommunicate statute maker writer statute also potestates consul gouernors counsellor place statute customes shall made kept also shall presume geue iudgement according put publike forme writing maners iudged lawes byshop rome authority claymeth god bee lawfull grace lawes customes realme contrary pope lawes naught aswell maiesty iudges iustices executor stand accursed among heretickes god forbid yet curse neuer auoyded pope haue power claymeth vntil time lawes customes realmethe pope lawes lawes england contrary beyng contrary lawes bee taken away blotted law bookes although bee many lawes realme contrary lawes rome yet named conuict clarke temporall iudge realme debt felony murther crime clarkes pope lawes exempt kynges lawes sued ordinary also pope lawes may geue byshoprickes benefice sprituall lawes realme geuen onely kinges patrones except fall lapse pope lawes ius patronatus shalbe sued onely ecclesiasticall iudge lawes realme shall sued temporall iudge short lawes realme agree pope lawes like fire water yet kinges realme haue prouided lawes premunire man haue let excution lawes realme authority sea rome falleth premunire meete pope haue prouided lawes cursing whosoeuer letteth pope lawes haue full course within realme pope power standeth accursed pope power treadeth lawes customes realme vnder feete cursing execute vntill time geue place vnto lawes may said notwithstanding pope decree yet execute still lawes customes realme nay quietly without interruption pope execute yet vniustly pope power force stand excommunicate shall doe vntill leaue execution owne lawes customes thus wel recociled rome allowing authority wherby realme standeth accursed god pope haue authority thinges suppose fully opened parliament house pope authority receiued agayne within realme beleue either king queenes maiesty noble realme common would euer haue consented receiue agayne forrayne authority iniurious hurtfull preiudiciall aswel crowne lawes customes state realme whereby must needes acknowledge themselues accursed none could ope matter wel clergy read pope lawes whereby pope hath made himselfe god seeke maintayne pope whome desired haue chiefe head intent might haue kingdome lawes within themselues distinct lawes crowne wherewith crowne may meddle exempted lawes crowne might liue realme like lordes kingesthe papistes set vp kingdome owne dissemble knowne truth false crowne without daminage feare man please high supreame head rome cosideration weene knew truth held peace parliament whereas done dueties crowne whole realme haue opened mouthes declared truth shewed peril daungers might ensue crowne realme agree allow authority within realme whereby must needes confesse gracious highnes also realme euer cotinue accursed vntill shall cease execution owne lawes customes realme could thinke selfe true either highnes naturall countrey knowing know ignorauce know may excuse men knoweth preiudiciall iniurious power authority chalengeth euery crowne lawes customes realme yet allow cannot set wise keepe due allegeaunce fidelity truth crowne state realme cause alleadged could allow authority popethe third cause could allow pope authority subuerteth onely lawes realme also lawes god whosoeuer vnder authority suffereth accordingly purpose ordayned holy dayes ought leauing apart busines geue theselues wholy know serue godwhy latin seruice ought restored english therefore god commaundement people gathered together minister use language people may vnderstand take profite thereby el hold peace harpe lute geue certayne sound men may know stricken dauce sound vaynes vayne profiteth nothing sayth almighty god mouth paule priest speake people language know el may profite himselfe profiteth people sayth paule herein aunswered thus paule spake onely preaching preacher speake tongue people know el preaching auayleth nothing preaching auaileth nothing spoken language people vnderstand seruice auayle spoken language yet paule mene onely preaching appeareth playnely owne word speaketh name expressely praying singing lauding thakyng god thing priestes say church whereunto people say amen vsed preaching diuine seruice whether priestes rehearse wonderfull workes god great benefites god vnto inankinde aboue creature geue thankes vnto god make open profession fayth humble confession theyr sinnes earnest request mercy forgeuenes make sute request vnto god thing people vnderstanding priestes say might ioyne mindes altogether sweet sauor odour incense nose thus vsed many hundred yeares christes ascension aforesayd thinges cannot done priestes speake people language knowen clarke name say amen canot tell ordayned sacrament moste precious body bloud receiued christian people vnder formes bread wine sayd cup drinke ye pope geueth cleane contrary commaundement lay man shall drinke cup saluation though cup saluation bloud christ pertayneth lay men wherefore theophilus alexandrinus whose work hierome translate eleue hundred yeares passed sayth christ bene crucified deuils cup denied yet pope denieth cup christ christen people whome christ crucified obay pope thinges must needes disobay sauior christ auswered hereto commonly papistes auswere vnder forme bread whole christ flesh bloud whosoeuer receiueth forme bread receiueth aswell christes bloud flesh let yet forme breade onely christ bloud drunken eaten receiued cup vnder forme wine christ commaunded eaten flesh vnder forme bread moreouer seperated representation death bloud separated flesh represented one kind alone lay people receiue whole sacrament whereby christes death represented commaunded moreouer pope taketh vpon geue higher pope hath done lifteth selfe aboue world bee aduersary christ dispense agaynst god lawes christ hath geuen commaundement comaunde directly contrary man must needes taken antichrist vntill tyme body heauen body christ sacrament owne doctrine must needes monstruous body hauyng neither distance member forme fashion proportion man naturall body body sacrament teach goeth mouth forme bread entreth farther forme bread goeth tarieth longer forme bread naturall heate digestyng forme bread digested body christ gone asmuch euill men long digestyng good men body christ doctrine entreth farre tarieth long wicked godly men comfort herein christian man receaue christes vnshapen body enter farther stomacke depart soone bread consumed seemeth sound comfortable doctrine christ hath one body hath forme fashion man true body body spiritually entreth whole man body soule though sacrament consumed yet whole christ remaineth feedeth receauer vnto eternall life continue godlynes neuer depart vntill receauer forsake wicked haue christ within belial fayth seemeth sound doctrine accordyng god word sufficient christian beleue matter shewed vnto pope authoritie preiudiciall thyngs mentioned sene accidentes doe without accidentes sunne present v earth supper lord abuse therof geueth lyfe receauer theodoretes dialogue sacrament transubstantiation subuerteth fayth authours thereof large confuted agaynst god word agaynst reason agaynst sence passeth fondnesse philosopher matter fayth contrary fayth old father papistes reason proue authours wrested absurdity follow thereon scripture
